payload.description: A Oembed consumer library, that gives you information about urls. It helps you replace urls to youtube or vimeo for example, with their html embed code.

commits.message:
Update Service.php

Fixed typo in comments

Provider Cleanup
- Removed the MyOpera provider. Myopera closed March 3, 2014.
- Fixed problems with the Sketchfab provider. The resource Url changed.
Removed 404 urls from Tests

Merged pull request #9 by Robby Taylor
- Typo fixed. Thanks!

Added support for Audiosnaps.com
- Added Tests for the new provider.
- Version bumped to 1.6

comment.body:
Hi! You are right! I wrote a quick fix for this issue, let me know what you think! If you want to modify the length of the "truncation", you have to instantiate the stream a little bit different.

```php
    new Stream('FacebookPages', array(
       'resource' => '140262999339534', // The page id
       'content_length' => 200, // The width of the desired trim
       'content_delimiter' => '...'
    ));


```

commits.message:
Added truncate and delimiter settings to the FacebookPages provider
- Version Bumped
- Updated the STREAMS.md documentation

Added tests for the Filesystem, Scanner, Collection and Logger classes
- Added a folder structure for the scanner/collection tests
- Stripped unused method from the Collection class, but implemented
  the countable interface.
- Minor docblock corrections
- Added setUp check to the Slug test file.
- Added config.yml to the exclude array inside Bolido
Added Placeholder to the plugins dir

Updated Year in the LICENSE file
- gitignore was also updated

Minor docblock cleanup in the Resource and FrontMatter classes
- Handle directories/folders on Resource::getContents.

Added Tests for the Config and Slug classes
- Minor tweaks to both classes
Updated travis.yml

Rewrote the way tags/categories were being fetched
- Created a new class responsable for the FrontMatter normalization
- Minor performance changes to the Resource class

Updated Dependencies/Test files
- Removed unused dependencies on composer.json
- Updated phpunit.xml and .scrutinizer.yml
- Added tests/Autoload.php

Improved modularity on the library
- Support for custom parsers
- Moved and refactored the FrontMatter class
- Added FileAnalyzer class
- Renamed the Generator and IndexMaker classes
- Simplified url/slug creation. Added Slug class
- Removed the Structure and Linker class
- Rewrote the Indexer class, to be a little more comprehensive
- The Logger class is now responsable for time tracking
- Simplified the Resource class

Overwriting already compiled files is now optional
- Updated the filesystem and filesystem interface
- Updated Test

Updated the BolidoCommand class
- The Bolido object could not be instantiated

Fixed bug when invalid front-matter is given, the whole process stops
- Updated the FrontMatter class

Added Config.php to the repository
- Fixed typo on the BolidoCommand class

Added Tests for FrontMatter and Resource
- Fixed bug on the Resource class. Files that are only a date
  would end as an empty string by the getFilenameShort method.
- 100% coverage for each class

Corrected typo on the STREAMS file
- Tagged the repo as 4.3

payload.description: A very simple and flexible library written in PHP for your life-streaming purposes. It supports a bunch of third party services like Youtube, StackOverflow, Reddit and Github.

commits.message:
Updated README, LICENSE and STREAM files.
- Corrected some typos and formatting errors.

issue.title: Option for relative date?
Possibly include a minimal CA bundle? Also two curl options should be set.
issue.body:
I had some issues with Twitter. I was able to resolve them by following guidance on Twitter's website. In particular, I had to include a CA bundle because the one on my system was presumably outdated. Twitter says that system certificates are unreliable to test against because they can be outdated or tampered with.

>Don't rely on the local operating system to validate the certificate if possible. This can be tampered with by malware, local IT staff, or other bad actors. Validate against the known vendors for api.twitter.com as listed above. Don't include more certificates in your application's trusted CA Root store from vendors that Twitter hasn't listed.

Also, Twitter recommends a couple of curl-specific options

> Twitter recommends that developers using TLS/SSL connections using libcurl verify that the CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER option is set to boolean value True (or integer value 1) and ensure that failure to return a successful verification results in a failed connection error rather than the establishment of an untrusted and unsecured connection. We also recommend that the SSL verifydepth be set to maximum (9) when possible.

See: https://dev.twitter.com/docs/security/using-ssl


Since I'm using WordPress, I simply included the CA bundle that comes with it and that resolved my issue. I also copied the other two curl options from the link above.

```php
    $config = [
        'language' => 'English',
        'cache_ttl' => (60*30),
        'cache_dir' => dirname(__DIR__) . '/cache',
        'prefer_curl' => true,
        'curl' => [
            CURLOPT_CAINFO => ABSPATH . WPINC . '/certificates/ca-bundle.crt',
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => true,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST => 2,
        ]
    ];
```

comment.body:
Hey!

On this last commit I added a certificate bundle and modified the twitter provider in order to use it automatically. You dont need to use the config array anymore!

I tested it and it seems to work! On the other hand If you have some time, can you test it and tell me if you found any bugs? I would like to hear the results from other people before tagging this commit as 4.3!

Thanks!

commits.message:
Added a certificate bundle in order to be able to work correctly
with twitter.
- In relation with Issue #2, thanks to @QWp6t
- Minor modifications to the http class, It is now allowed to pass
  different contexts into the fopen wrapper.
- Minor modifications to the twitter and http tests.
